dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4218 IH: Puerto Rico National Scenic Trail Study Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. González-Colón (for herself, Mrs. Radewagen, and Mr. Sablan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the National Trails System Act to provide for a study of the Puerto Rico National Scenic Trail.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Puerto Rico National Scenic Trail Study Act.

section.header: Puerto Rico National Scenic Trail Study
section.text: Section 5(c) of the National Trails System Act (16 U.S.C. 1244(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Puerto Rico National Scenic Trail, a system of trails and potential trails extending approximately 200 miles from the Cabezas de San Juan Nature Reserve in Fajardo, Puerto Rico, to Morrillos Peninsula in Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico, through El Yunque National Forest and the Sierra de Luquillo mountains, the Sierra de Cayey and the Cordillera Central mountain ranges, and the dry forests along the southwestern coast of Puerto Rico.
